correction.p: OCR generated transcript has not been corrected.

normalization.p: Only minor normalization where needed, if any, is indicated via markup.

punctuation.p: All punctuation marks in the source text have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.
Punctuation may be marked up with pc elements for clarification, but not exclusively.

quotation.p: All quotation marks have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.

hyphenation.p: Hyphenated words that appear at the end of a line have been retained. The hyphen, if present, is represented by the Unicode code point, and marked up with a pc element. The break="no" attribute on the lb element indicates that a single word is split across the lines.

interpretation.p: Dates, places, and names may be marked up, where useful.

VALID IN SCHOOL DISTRICTS NOT MAINTAINING ACADEMIC DEPARTMENTS
Be it known that Alice I. Harrison of Hornby, NY
having completed a one-year approved professional course in the teachers training class at
Corning following graduation from an approved four-year high school course at
Northside H.S. Corning and having met the full requirements as to character and ability to teach,
is therefore entitled, under the rules prescribed by the Regents of the University, to this certificate
which is a valid license to teach for three years from August 1, .1925 when indorsed by a district
superintendent of schools. This certificate is not renewable but may be applied toward advanced
standing in a state normal school.
No. 27983
Given under my hand this 10th day of August 1925
Frank B. Gilbert
Acting Commissioner of Education
VALID IN ANY ELEMENTARY SCHOOL
Be it known that ALICE I. HARRISON of Hornby, N.Y.
having completed in good standing the first two years of the three-year professional course in the State
Normal School at Geneseo, specializing in grammar grades is
therefore entitled, under the rules prescribed by the Education Department, to this certificate which
is a valid license to teach for three years from August 1, 1929. This certificate is not renewable but
may be extended for two years upon the completion of twelve semester hours' credit in advanced
professional courses of the third year.
In witness whereof, for and on behalf of the State Education
Department, I have hereunto set my hand at the city of
Albany this 19th day of August 1929
J. Cayce Morrison
Assistant Commissioner of Education
The within certificate is issued and made valid in the
second supervisory district of Steuben county.
Dated Sept. 7, 1929.
Winford Morrow,
District Superintendent.
New York State Department of Health
DIVISION OF VITAL STATISTICS

§ 376. Registration of StUlborn Childreri. A stillborn child .shall be rc^t.i-

(3) Mutilated, grossly soiled or defaced, inaccurate;
(4) Containing any erasure, interlineation, correction, or

Note.—If a mistake is made and observed before the certifi
cate is accepted for registration, another blanlc may be filled out
correctly and substituted for the erroneous certificate; but no

by the registrar, and no pthei record made in pursuance of this
article, shall be altered or changed in any respect otherwise than
by amendments properly dated, signed and witnessed: (See §387.)

The medical certificate of the cause of death shall be signed by the attendin^

§ 3S2. Registration of Births. The birth of each and every child born in
this state shall be registered within five days after the date of each birtb^, tlFihe

shall be the duty of .such physician, midwife or person acting as midwife, to
file said certificate. In each case where there was no physician, midwife, or
person acting as midwife, in attendance upon the birth, it shall be the duty of
the father or mother of the child, the householder or owner of the premises
whore the birth occurred, or the morugcr or superintendent of the public or
private institution-wdiere the birth occrirred, each in the order named, within
five days after the date of such birth to report to the local registrar the fact
of such birth. In such case and in ciko the phy.sieian, midwife or person act
